casebody.data:
William A. GALVIN, Movant/Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. No. ED 106453 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION THREE. Filed: April 2, 2019 James C. Egan, 1000 West Nifong, Bldg. 7, Suite 100, Columbia, MO 65203, for appellant. Eric S. Schmitt, Atty. Gen., Gregory L. Barnes, Asst. Atty. Gen., P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, respondent. Before Sherri B. Sullivan, P.J., Lawrence E. Mooney, J., and James M. Dowd, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

The movant, William Galvin, appeals the judgment entered by the Circuit Court of Lincoln County denying his Rule 29.15 motion for post-conviction relief after an evidentiary hearing. We have reviewed the parties' briefs and the record on appeal and find no clear error. Rule 29.15(k). An opinion would have no precedential value. The parties have been provided with a memorandum, for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this decision.

We affirm the motion court's judgment denying the movant's Rule 29.15 motion for post-conviction relief. Rule 84.16(b)(2).
